prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.2582, 0.75, 0.0]. For the first face, create a loop consisting of the following lines: - Line 1: From (0.0, 0.0) to (0.15, 0.0) - Line 2: From (0.15, 0.0) to (0.15, 0.076) - Line 3: From (0.15, 0.076) to (0.1125, 0.076) - Line 4: From (0.1125, 0.076) to (0.1125, 0.0375) - Line 5: From (0.1125, 0.0375) to (0.0375, 0.0375) - Line 6: From (0.0375, 0.0375) to (0.0375, 0.075) - Line 7: From (0.0375, 0.075) to (0.0, 0.075) - Line 8: From (0.0, 0.075) to (0.0, 0.0) This loop is a closed shape, forming the outline for the first face of the prism. Now, scale this 2D sketch by a factor of 0.15. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector defined earlier. Extrude the 3D sketch along its normal direction by 0.75 units to create the prism with a cylindrical hole through its center, positioned diagonally from the bottom left to the top right corner. The height of the prism is approximately twice the width. **Part 2: Construct a tapered rectangular prism** Create a new coordinate system with the Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.75, 0.149]. For the first face, draw a loop consisting of the following lines: - Line 1: From (0.0, 0.0375) to (0.0, 0.075) - Line 2: From (0.0, 0.075) to (0.15, 0.075) - Line 3: From (0.15, 0.075) to (0.15, 0.0375) - Line 4: From (0.15, 0.0375) to (0.1125, 0.0375) - Line 5: From (0.1125, 0.0375) to (0.1125, 0.0) - Line 6: From (0.1125, 0.0) to (0.0375, 0.0) - Line 7: From (0.0375, 0.0) to (0.0375, 0.0375) - Line 8: From (0.0375, 0.0375) to (0.0, 0.0375) This loop is closed, forming the outline for the first face of the tapered prism. Next, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.15. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector defined earlier. Extrude the 3D sketch along its normal direction by 0.075 units to create the tapered rectangular prism with the top being wider than the bottom. The sides of this prism are parallel to each other.</description>
